cyclone.name: HAROLD
cyclone.current_location: about 480 miles ESE of Port Mansfield, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: tracking west toward the south-central Texas coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southern Texas coast near Baffin Bay, just south of Corpus Christi

weather_observation.warning_coast: Mouth of Rio Grande to Port O'Connor, TX (includes Corpus Christi)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: south Texas coast from the Mouth of the Rio Grande northward to Sargent, including Corpus Christi Bay
weather_observation.wind: Tropical storm–force winds (sustained 39–45 mph, higher gusts) possible Tuesday morning through afternoon.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft inundation possible in Corpus Christi Bay and adjacent coastlines during high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain totals 3–5 inches with isolated 7 inches Tuesday–Wednesday, risk of flash and urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents along the middle Texas coast beginning Monday night.
